user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_BSP_GetResourceTypeConfig:
```c
uint32 OS_BSP_GetResourceTypeConfig(uint32 ResourceType)
{
    uint32 ConfigOptionValue;

    if (ResourceType < OS_OBJECT_TYPE_USER)
    {
        ConfigOptionValue = OS_BSP_Global.ResoureConfig[ResourceType];
    }
    else
    {
        ConfigOptionValue = 0;
    }

    return ConfigOptionValue;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_BSP_GetResourceTypeConfig:
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_USER 0x10
...
extern OS_BSP_GlobalData_t OS_BSP_Global
...
typedef uint32_t  uint32
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No suspicious fragments found. The function OS_BSP_GetResourceTypeConfig contains no function calls (direct or indirect), no function-pointer dereference, and no macros that expand to function calls. It only performs an integer comparison, an array data access (OS_BSP_Global.ResoureConfig[ResourceType]), assigns to a local scalar, and returns that scalar. The related symbols shown (OS_OBJECT_TYPE_USER macro, extern OS_BSP_Global, and the uint32 typedef) are data or constant definitions and do not introduce recursion. Therefore there are no fragments in the provided code that could violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 (no self-calls).
